title: Inventory Audit Process
content:
• Home
  • ››Manhattan Active® Omni
  • ››Store

  • ››Inventory Audit

Inventory Audit Process

  • Available Inventory Audit Information
  • Services 

Inventory audit allows store associates to view the inventory audit information in the store for the transaction types that are configured. This information can be used to analyze the inventory transactions for manual adjustments, cycle counts, receipts, resolve error, and out of stock. The inventory audit does not show transaction information outside of the manual adjustments, cycle counts, receipts, resolve error, and out of stock.

Available Inventory Audit Information

Inventory audit is updated when items are received or manually adjusted by the store employee based on the configuration mentioned in the Inventory Audit Configuration guide. Inventory audit identifies an increase, a decrease, or movement of the inventory. 

For Inventory Audit, only SIM transactions are supported. Any changes made outside of SIM (ie: POS or Supply Events) may not appear in the inventory audit logs.

The following fields are available at a supply event for Inventory audit purposes. Store transactions populate below values on the supply event sent to Inventory Management system so that inventory audit information can be consolidated at the common place.

  1. Inventory Transaction Type
  2. Inventory Transaction Id

Inventory audit contains the following information for each inventory audit transaction type:

Receipt
  • Identification of the system transaction
  • Transaction identifier (Package ID, Item ID or Order ID)
  • Type of transaction
  • Transaction date time 
  • Receipt quantity
  • User associated with the receipt
  • Disposition (For the exception/disposition related records when the "Adjust Inventory during receiving" feature is enabled)
Manual Adjustment
  • Identification of the manual transaction
  • Transaction date and time 
  • Adjustment type 
  • Adjustment reason
  • From disposition (applicable in case of inventory movement)
  • To disposition (applicable in case of inventory movement)
  • Disposition (applicable in case of inventory addition and subtraction)
  • Comments
  • Quantity adjusted (Increase, decrease or movement)
  • User that performed the adjustment
Note: When the RFID flow is enabled, the absence of the From Disposition and the Disposition fields from the Inventory Audit records indicate that the respective unit's current disposition is null. In these cases, adjustments happen based on the default supply type configured in the Inventory component.
Tip: For more information on how the Inventory Audit UI behaves when the RFID flow is enabled, please refer to the "Inventory Audit picture after Adjustment using RFID" UI help guide.
Cycle count
  • Identification of the manual transaction
  • Cycle count  identifier (Count ID)
  • Type of transaction
  • Transaction date time 
  • Quantity sent to correct inventory based on the actual count ( Increase or decrease)
  • User counted/ approved the count - If cycle count gets into the review process, user who approved the count else, user who counted the cycle count.

Inventory audit can be filtered based on:

  • Item
  • Date range
  • Adjustment type
  • Transaction type
  • User
Resolve Error

Store associates can apply the filter of 'resolve error' to see the details of those items that are resolved from the error. In the result, it shows the information below.

  • Item ID
  • Date
  • Store disposition
  • Type Resolve error
  • Transaction ID
  • User 

Out Of Stock

Store associates can apply the filter of 'out of stock' to see the details of those items that are marked as out of stock. In the result, it shows the information below.

  • Item ID
  • Date
  • Store disposition
  • Type Out Of Stock
  • Transaction ID
  • User 

Services 

The APIs listed in the following table are referenced in this document. Refer to the API documentation for additional details on each service.

 

Service
 Component Group
Service End Point
Delete Inventory Audit SIM InventoryLog Services /sim/api/sim/inventoryLog/{k}
Get Inventory Audit SIM InventoryLog Services /sim/api/sim/inventoryLog
Get Inventory Audit by Transaction ID SIM InventoryLog Services /sim/api/sim/inventoryLog/transactionId/{transactionId}/transactionDetailId/{transactionDetailId}
Save Inventory Log SIM InventoryLog Services /sim/api/sim/inventoryLog/save
Update Inventory Log by Transaction ID SIM InventoryLog Services /sim/api/sim/inventoryLog/transactionId/{transactionId}/transactionDetailId/{transactionDetailId}
